channel.title: Posts on Tatsu Online
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Tatsu Online

item.title: Censorship in the Marketplace of Ideas
item.description: Introduction Over the last few years, the online video-sharing platform YouTube has been subject to a series of policy changes that have had a profound effect on the type of content and the types of ideas that are expressed or discussed by creators on the platform. Through examples and comparisons, I will attempt to argue that YouTube has fallen prey to the same fiscal compulsions that led to the censorship of printed media in the United States during its “golden era” of the early nineteenth century.

item.title: The EARN IT Act
item.description: Introduction Earlier this month, United States Senators Lindsey Graham and Richard Blumenthal introduced a bill on the floor, the so-called EARN IT Act. The title of the bill is a backronym which spells out “E liminating A busive and R ampant N eglect of I nteractive T echnologies”. The purported goal of this bill is to establish a National Commission on Online Child Sexual Exploitation Prevention; however, the bill also exploits the general lack of public understanding of the technology behind encryption in an effort to eliminate its use.

item.title: Visualizing Maxwell's Equations
